revised_title: Optimal Excise Proportioning on Spirituous Liquors
tldr: The author, Charles Blagden, conducted experiments to determine the best method of proportioning the excise tax on spirituous liquors. By measuring the specific gravity of various mixtures, Blagden aimed to establish a fair tax system based on alcohol content. The study involved multiple experiments, taking into account factors such as temperature and evaporation, to ensure accurate results.
